intro: Dorstenia triternata, commonly known as the three-parted dwarf banana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Musaceae, which includes true bananas and plantains. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescence and distinctive, trifoliate leaves. It produces edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
